sentences.sContent: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.sCn: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.sContent: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.sCn: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.sContent: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.sCn: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.sContent: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.sCn: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.sContent: ...survey respondents disagree over whether this generation will follow in their parents，footsteps...
...it will die off with the generation who read print newspapers...
...And isn't this the generation who say they're concerned about their health and the well－being of the planet...
...every generation has a claim to having been most injured...
...The handicraft has been passed down from one generation to another and now enjoys more and more popularity both at home and abroad...
...the new generation can find it more difficult to advance--an argument that typically holds little sway to a nevertiree...
...a generation was brought up with food that couldn't compete with neighboring France...

...Campus plays a crucial role in educating the young generation and the consciousness of “green campus” will definitely produce a profound effect on students’ various environmental protection activities after their graduation...
...the young generation is under the burden of severe environmental pollution and there are many problems waiting for them to solve...

synos.tran: 一代；产生；一代人；[生物]生殖

phrases.pCn: 发电，发电量；发电机设备
n. 代沟（两代人之间的隔阂）
煤气化；气体的产生；气体发生
倍频效应；二次谐波发生

words.tran: 生殖的；生产的；有生殖力的；有生产力的

trans.tranOther: all people of about the same age
